channel.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
channel.description:
Which one do you think is better?
Which one do you think will be more successful in the long run?
Do you think any of them will fall?
Please discus what you think is the better social network.

item.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

Twitter, its not a life waster and I actually have fun. Facebook people whine too much.

item.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

To me, Facebook is way to help talk to people you can’t see often, share media, or anything of the sort. Twitter is just a way for people to keep others updated, and works best with Game devs, ect. Although a Blog could easily replace needs for Twitter, Facebook and Google+ aren’t that bad.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

Zohr:

So everybody pretty much agrees that Facebook is fucked up, but still the best social network?

for games and connections then yes. but as more ppl try out google+ im sure they will like it much better. its cleaner, simpler, all the features u could/should want from a social network, and more control over ur stuff. so if more ppl convert to g+ then it will be better b/c more games will come about if thats what they want, also u will be able to talk to ur friends. i have just a few ppl from my fb on my g+ thats why i have to still use fb…

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:22, topic:421696”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=524353.msg3816317#msg3816317 date=1321383296]
Really though, you can’t say one is better than another. They serve different functions and purposes. Facebook is very good for massive streamlined social networking using groups (though google+ is doing a much better job than them). Twitter is an amazing concept for fast-paced and streamlined news feeds. If you want real news in realtime, twitter is the way to go (and, in my opinion, probably the future of news media).

And honestly, I normally don’t comment about this sort of stuff, but don’t just go and call something stupid if you yourself don’t understand why it’s used. It’s fine if you don’t use it and if you find it stupid, but it’s a waste of our time to read your cynicism in this topic. At least try and provide some sort of reason why you think it’s negative. If you don’t have much of a social life, you probably don’t have any reasons to post.
[/quote]Exactly what I said, twitter is a good news feed, and Facebook is (or in my opinion - was) good for general social media. I’m assuming you were directing that at me (if not I apologize), but if you are I’m also assuming you didn’t read my other posts as I explained my reasons in them. I also said I do/did use them, and I did have a social life at the time :rolleyes:

@Chassy - The number of rich and famous people that use twitter (and actually post for themselves, it’s pretty common for them to have people post for them) is relatively low[/quote]

Not really. I know you have more of a social life than you let on. I get overly annoyed with ignorance from time to time. I probably shouldn’t have even posted.

Read full topic

item.title: Facebook vs. Twitter
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:24, topic:421696”]Noun:
A series of short, high-pitched calls or sounds.

or

An online social networking and microblogging service that enables its users to send and read text-based posts of up to 140 characters, informally known as “tweets”.[/quote]
lulz
Twitter never got me warm,
i never have been on it and never will
